company_profile: Saigon - Hanoi Commercial Joint Stock Bank (SHB), formerly known as Nhon Ai Rural Commercial Bank, was established in 1993. The main business activities of SHB include capital mobilization, receiving capital, lending, joint venture capital and payment services. SHB has been traded on Hochiminh Stock Exchange (HOSE) since October 11, 2021. In 2024, compared to the same period, the net interest margin (NIM) stood at 3.27%, reflecting a decrease of 0.26%. The non-performing loan ratio was at 2.9%, decreasing of 0.12%. The coverage ratio for non-performing loans (NPL) was at 58.39%, decreasing of 10.35%. The net profit after tax of parent company is valued at VND9.3 trillion, increased 27.27%. The return on equity (ROE) was at 17.24%, up 1.48%
history_dev: November 13, 1993: The forerunner of Saigon - Hanoi Commercial Joint Stock Bank (SHB) was Nhon Ai Rural Joint Stock Commercial Bank established with a charter capital of VND 400 million. September 11, 2006: Transformed into Saigon - Hanoi Commercial Joint Stock Bank (SHB) with a charter capital of VND 500 billion. August 14, 2007: Increased charter capital to VND 2,000 billion. April 20, 2009: Shares of companies listed on HNX. January 28, 2010: SHB officially became a member of the Asian Banking Association (ABA). In 2011: SHB raised its charter capital to nearly VND 5,000 billion. 2012: SHB established 2 branches in Phnom Penh - Cambodia and Laos. 2012: Hanoi Housing Commercial Joint Stock Bank (HBB) merged into SHB. October 2012: Increased charter capital to VND 8,865 billion; 2015: Increased charter capital to VND 9,485 billion; June 2016: Increased charter capital to VND 11,196 billion; March 2017: Increased charter capital to VND 12,036 billion; March 11, 2021: Increased charter capital to VND17,510.09 billion; June 09, 2021: Increased charter capital to VND19,260.48 billion;  October 06, 2021: Delisted from Hanoi Stock Exchange (HNX); October 11, 2021: Traded on Ho Chi Minh Stock Market (HOSE). August 12, 2022: Increased charter capital to VND 26,673.69 billion; January 6, 2023:  Increased charter capital to VND 30,673.73 billion; September 20, 2023: Increased charter capital to VND36,193.98 billion; June 27, 2024: Increased charter capital to VND36,629.08 billion; April 8, 2025: Increased charter capital to VND40,657.47 billion; September 23, 2025: Increased charter capital to VND 45,942 billion;
key_developments: Credit granting Financial services: mobilization, foreign exchange businesses, international trade finance, discounting commercial papers, bonds and other valuable papers, trading gold, safe box keeping services,... SHB gives priority to Small and Medium Enterprises.
business_strategies: Becoming a dynamic and multi-functional retail bank closely approaching the international management standards; Executing the retail banking strategy; Developing profitable financial investment plans and diversify financial investment models.
